Util.MyDataStructures.Implementations

Class NodeIndexed<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Util.MyDataStructures.Implementations.NodeIndexed<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<NodeIndexed<T>>

    public class NodeIndexed<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<NodeIndexed<T>>
    Author:
    Matt 6/12/2017. Node class is used to created a linked list of nodes where the element being stored is placed in private field 'info' and the right to the next node is placed in private field 'right'. A NodeIndexed is: ------------------------------- | left | index | info | right | -------------------------------

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NodeIndexed(T info)
      A constructor that creates a new node and stores the element inserted into the param info.

      • NodeIndexed

        public NodeIndexed(T info)
        A constructor that creates a new node and stores the element inserted into the param info. The right is null by default.

        public NodeIndexed<T> getRight()
        Returns the node connected to this node if any. Will return null if no node is linked.
        Returns:

      • linkTo

        public void linkTo(NodeIndexed<T> nodeToLink)
        Called on a NodeIndexed instance and connects the instance to nodeToLink. Sets the index of nodeToLink based on the NodeIndexed instances index field. when inserting a new node always setup the left side links
        Parameters:
        nodeToLink - the node that is being connected to.
